titleStmt.title: South Asian Manuscripts at the Bodleian Libraries

msDesc.head: NOTE: This record has yet to be fully checked.
Mahāsarasvatīsūkta, &c., 19th cent.?

msContents.summary: Nine separate pieces, which, however, all bear on the same subject, the worship of a Tantric deity

msItem.note: The Mahāsarasvatīsūkta, consists of thirty-four verses
msItem.incipit: apārasaṃsārasamudramadhye nimajjato me śaraṇaṃ kim asti | guroḥ kṛpālo kṛpayā vadaitad viśveśapādāṃbujadīrghanauka ǁ 1 ǁ

msItem.note: The Mahālakṣmīsūkta, consists of twenty verses
msItem.incipit: śrī ṣṇovāca | mama nayaṃti munayaḥ prakṛtipurāṇaṃ vidyoti yāṃ śrutirahasyavido gṛṇaṃti tām arddhapallavitasaṃkarūpamudrāṃ devīm ananyaśaraṇaḥ śaraṇāṃ prapadye ǁ 1 ǁ
msItem.explicit: iti vi ktā hā kṣml ktaḥ |

msItem.note: The Mahākālīsūkta, consists of fifteen verses:
msItem.incipit: Śiva uvāca | suṃdarī tripurā kāmā bhavārii sādhakaḥ priyā | amohā satyavacanā vimohā mohanāśi | amṛtesi ca kalyāṇī kāruṇyā kamalā kalā kalātītā komalāṃtaśuṣkaraṇī viśvanāyikā ǁ 2 ǁ
śrīrāmajī | uttama sarvavidyānāṃ sarvabhūtavaśaṃkarī | sarvasiddhikarī vidyā mahāsārasvatī pradām | oṃ asya śrīmahāvidyāmaṃtrasya Aghora ṛṣiḥ | paramātmā Rudro devatā anuṣṭub chaṃdaḥ | &c.

msItem.note: The Tripurasundarīkavaca, consists of forty-five verses
msItem.incipit: śrīgaṇeśā srīpurāyai namaḥ | śṛṇu Tripurasuṃdaryyā rahasyaṃ kāmanāvahaṃ | jagaccintāmaṇir nāma kavacaṃ maṃtravigrahaṃ ǁ 1 ǁ

msItem.note: The Bāladevīpaṭala, consists of sixty verses
msItem.incipit: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ | atha vātapaṭala likhyatai | Kailāsasikharāsīnaṃ devadevaṃ jogadguruṃ | uvāca Pārvatī devī sarveśvaraṃ sadāśivaṃ ǁ 1 ǁ
msItem.explicit: iti Rudrayāmale Iśvarapārvatīśvarasaṃvāde triº pūº paṭº |

msItem.note: The Laghustotra, consists of twenty-two most elaborate and ornate verses. It ends:
The Bālahṛdaya, consists of thirty-nine verses from the Jālasaṃvaramahātantra, an otherwise unknown work. It ends:
The Nāmāṣṭakasahasraka consists of 219 verses, enumerating the names of Devī and dwelling on the good results of studying the work. The title given above comes from verse 204.
msItem.incipit: oṃ purā Kailāsaśikhare nānārainopacitrite | devadevaṃ mahādevaṃ samāsīnaṃ jagadguruṃ ǁ 1 ǁ
msItem.explicit: etasya paṭhanād devi dharaṇād vā viśeṣataḥ | satyaṃ ca sādhakaḥ satyaṃ sākṣi devaḥ sadāśivaḥ ǁ 219 ǁ

recordHist.source:
Summary description abbreviated from the following sources:
Winternitz and Keith, Catalogue of Sanskrit manuscripts, no. 1477 (1–9), p. 273

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card (for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Admissions). Contact specialcollections.enquiries@bodleian.ox.ac.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript.

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Moriz Winternitz and Arthur Berriedale Keith, Catalogue of Sanskrit manuscripts in the Bodleian Library (Oxford, 1905), no. 1477 (1–9), p. 273
